law.catch_line: There is a Commission on Aging in the Department....

text.section: There is a Commission on Aging in the Department.

section.section:
The Commission consists of 13 members appointed by the Governor as follows:
1 shall be a member of the Senate of Maryland, who may not vote;
1 shall be a member of the Maryland House of Delegates, who may not vote; and
11 shall be selected to reflect the geographic diversity of the State and because of their interest in the needs of seniors.
At least 7 members shall be at least 55 years old.
The term of a member of the Commission is 4 years.
The terms of members appointed under subsection (b)(1)(iii) of this section are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on October 1, 2007.
A member of the Commission appointed under subsection (b)(1)(iii) of this section may not serve more than two consecutive terms.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: From among the members of the Commission, the Governor shall designate a chair.

A member of the Commission:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Commission; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations as provided in the State budget.

The Commission shall:
exercise the powers and perform the duties specified in this title;
review:
ongoing statewide programs and activities for seniors; and
new statewide programs for seniors before the programs are implemented;
make recommendations to the Secretary about statewide programs and activities for seniors; and
prepare and submit an annual report to the Governor and the Secretary that includes recommendations for legislative or other actions to strengthen statewide programs and activities for seniors.
